member.summary: Returns a value corresponding to a tag string associated with a UI element. When 's UI elements (such as toolbar items) are created, their properties are assigned predefined strings that determine actions performed when those elements are invoked. member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewFileActions.FileOpen(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads the document from a specified file. If the file does not exist uses its directory as the initial directory for the "open file" dialog.
member.param: The name of the file to open.
If true, error message is shown if an exception occurs, otherwise the exception is rethrown.
member.returns: The opened document or null if operation was cancelled, or if is true and an error occurred while loading the document.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewFileActions.FileSave(System.String,C1.C1Preview.Export.ExportProvider,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Saves (exports) the current document in the specified file. If is empty or specifies a directory, the user can select a file name in a "save file" dialog. If specified, determines the save/export format, otherwise the file extension is used.
member.param: If true, error message is shown if an exception occurs, otherwise the exception is rethrown.
member.returns: true if the current document was saved, false if operation was cancelled, or if is true and an error occurred while saving the document.

member.summary: Saves (exports) the current document in the specified file. The user can select a file name in a "save file" dialog. The save/export format is determined by the file extension.

member.summary:
Creates a new object with the specified .
The newly created object is then added to the collection.
Adding of the new state to history can be cancelled in the event.
member.param: The value defining user action associated with the new history item.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.AddCurrentViewStateToHistory(C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Creates a new object using the current state of the .
The newly created object is then added to the collection. Adding of the new state to history is cancelled if the property of the current preview pane is null, or if the specified action should not be saved according to the value of the current pane's .
Adding of the new state to history can also be cancelled in the event.
member.param: A value defining the user action associated with the new history item.
The caption of the new history item.
If true, forces adding of the current state even if it is equal to the state stored in the .
member.returns: The newly created object, or null if the action was cancelled.

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.ClientToDocument(System.Drawing.Point,System.Int32@,System.Drawing.PointF@)
member.summary:
Converts a point in the current 's client coordinates, to document coordinates.
Document coordinates are also pixels, but are relative to a specific page's left top corner, and do not depend on the current zoom factor.
For instance, a client point that is over a page's right top corner would yield a point with document coordinates (816,0) on a 96 DPI resolution display for a 8.5 in wide page (816 is 8.5 multiplied by 96), regardless of the current zoom factor or document scroll position in the preview.
member.returns: True if a page containing the specified point has been found, false otherwise.

member.param: 0-based page index of the document point.
member.returns: True if the client point belongs to a document page, false otherwise.

member.param: OUT: Rectangle converted to preview pane client coordinates.
member.returns: True if the client rectangle's location belongs to a document page, false otherwise.

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets or sets the current history entry.
Assigning to this property moves the preview pane in history. The value being assigned must be an element in the collection.
Note that in some situations the current history entry can not be changed (e.g. when the operation is attempted while the preview is changing its state). In those cases the set operation will be ignored.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.Busy
member.summary: Gets or sets the flag indicating whether the preview pane is currently busy. Some actions (especially those that could cause significant changes in the preview pane's state) raise this flag themselves, and cannot be performed when this flag was raised by another operation. This flag should be tested before attempting to change preview pane's properties or invoke methods on it.
member.value: The value of the Busy flag.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.StartPageIdx
member.summary: Gets or sets the 0-based index of the currently visible page. If several pages are visible, this property indicates the page with the most surface shown. When the property is set, the new start page's top left corner is aligned with the preview window's top left corner.

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.PreviewScrollPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the top left corner of the preview area (the scroll position) within the preview window. The value is relative to the PreviewRectangle, not to the ClientRectangle. The value is independent of the ZoomFactor (i.e. setting the same values will scroll to the same logical position in the document at any zoom factor).

member.summary: Gets or sets the mouse mode (zoom, selection etc.).

member.name: P:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.HideMarginsAvail
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether horizontal or vertical margins can be hidden on the current document. Margins can hide if all pages have the same size. Additionally, horizontal margins can also hide if the preview has one column.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether horizontal and/or vertical margins should be hidden.

member.name: T:C1.Win.C1Preview.C1PreviewPane.LayoutSection
member.summary: Helper class providing a section inside which the preview layout is suspended. Should be used to enclose fragments of code where several properties on which the preview pages layout depends are changed. Layout updating is suspended between the construction and disposing of the class instance. Sample usage: using (LayoutSection ls = new LayoutSection(previewPane)) { ..code... }.

member.remarks: When triggered, this option saves the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentChangeMargins
member.summary: State before margins on the current document are changed is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, this option saves the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentChangePageSettings
member.summary: State before page settings on the current document are changed is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, this option saves the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentAction
member.summary: State before any of the document-related changes occur is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, all document-related actions save the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.DocumentChangedAction
member.summary: State before any of the document-related changes (except the opening of a new document) occur is saved in history.
member.remarks: When triggered, all document-related actions save the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.name: F:C1.Win.C1Preview.HistorySavedActionsEnum.All
member.summary: State before any of the supported changes occur is saved in history.
member.remarks: Note that this option includes DocumentAction, which, when triggered, saves the current document, and thus may cause delays and/or increase memory consumption, especially in the case of large documents.

member.summary:
Gets the caption representing the current visited document with description of the change that caused it to be saved appended.
For instance, if the current visited document was saved when the user changed page settings, the value of this property can be "Document1 (page settings changed)".

member.name: M:C1.Win.C1Preview.VisitedDocument.CreateDocument
member.summary:
Creates an instance of the document that is stored in the current visited document.
Note that if the current visited document is linked with the document that is currently open in the preview pane, that document object is returned.
